Stephanie Davis DELETES Jeremy McConnell statement after he takes paternity test on live TV What could this mean for the ex-couple? Stephanie Davis has deleted any trace of the statement she put out after her ex, Jeremy McConnell , took swabs for a DNA test on live TV. 
Following the This Morning segment on Thursday, during which Jeremy opened up about not being there for Steph throughout her pregnancy, the ex-Hollyoaks star had tweeted a statement about Jez's treatment of her. 
She said she felt "humiliated" by the way in which Jeremy demanded to know whether he was the father of her newborn baby, Caben-Albi, and said he had ruined her pregnancy. The statement tweeted by Steph on Thursday (Photo: Twitter/@Stephdavis77) She also shared this quote from Jeremy alongside one of his old tweets (Photo: Twitter/@Stephdavis77) 
"Stephanie has felt humiliated by Jeremy denying his own son and foolishly announcing publicly his request for a DNA test," the statement read. 
"Jeremy has caused Stephanie massive amounts of stress, pressure and upset throughout her pregnancy, ruining what for most women is one of the most special time[s] of their lives." 
It went on: "Jeremy has at no point throughout the pregnancy or birth been in contact directly with Stephanie. Jeremy was categorically not banned from the birth, nor did he ever ask to attend. Jeremy appeared tearful on This Morning (Photo: Rex Features) He said he'd "110%" stand up and be a dad if the paternity test gave a positive match (Photo: Rex Features) 
"Jeremy has been given the option at all times to take part in a DNA test, because of past behaviour Stephanie has requested that this is handled via the correct channels and managed by her solicitor." 
The statement also brought up Jeremy's "audacity" at turning the situation "into a media circus" and accused him of trying to handle it "on his terms only". 
But Steph has since taken down the statement, plus screengrabs of a previous tweet posted by Jeremy that denied it was his baby. 
Mirror Celeb has contacted Stephanie for comment. Stephanie has been out of hospital with her newborn boy for a month now (Photo: WENN.COM) 
Meanwhile, Jeremy has been busy doing some clearing up of his own social accounts, having deleted a string of abusive messages sent to him on Facebook after he shared a clip of his This Morning interview. 
He was quickly met with a barrage of negative comments from viewers and fans. (Photo: Instagram/Jeremy McConnell) (Photo: Instagram/Jeremy McConnell) 
In between foul-mouthed insults, one person wrote: "God he will do anything for abit of publicity!! He's a first class t***er (sic)" 
Another commented: "Said he would of been at the birth .... was in Thailand getting smashed ! Dad of the year (sic)" (Photo: Instagram/Jeremy McConnell) (Photo: Instagram/Jeremy McConnell) 
After the strongly-worded backlash, Jeremy appeared to first delete all the negative responses - before then removing the post itself. Like us on Facebook
